title: Krept stabbing: Man who sent leaked audio of rapper confesses
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

A friend of Krept & Konan rapper Krept who was stabbed last weekend, has taken ‘responsibility’ for audio that was leaked of the rapper detailing the horrific incident.

Krept, real name Casyo Johnson, suffered multiple injuries when he was slashed during a backstage altercation at BBC Radio 1Xtra Live at Birmingham Arena on Saturday.

The Freak of the Week rapper was treated on-site and did not need to go to a hospital, but the concert was abruptly cut short.

Hours after the terrifying incident, an audio clip of Krept recalling the incident to a friend was doing the rounds on social media.

Fans were outraged that a friend of Krept’s betrayed his trust and privacy.

Following the backlash, Krept’s friend and rapper Clue revealed he had passed on the Whatsapp voice note to another friend, who in turn leaked it publicly.

In a series of Instagram Stories, Clue explained: ‘I’m the one responsible for sending that Whatsapp [clip].

Clue admits sending Krept’s audio to a friend who then leaked it online (Picture: clueofficial, Instagram, Getty)

‘Shout out to my man Krept, that’s my brother. We done spoke… He already knows. I’m not going to go in too deep about why man posted it because it’s not a thing of man posting it purposely for it to do this type of marathon.’

Explaining how the audio clip found its way into the public domain, Clue continued: ‘One of my close dogs who I was just breaking down a situation of my brother Krept… hence why I sent on the voice note so my brother could hear, “Oh no my man is calm”. Unfortunately he’s let me down but I take that on my shoulders because I’m big enough to do that [sic].’

Clearly feeling remorseful about the situation, Clue said: ‘I apologise to my brother and I’ll do it publicly as well, because he sent that to me in confidence. I f****d that one up there.

‘So if anyone’s got anything to say, aim it at me. Don’t call my brother a snitch because that’s not even the case. He sent that to his bredrin.’

Fortunately Krept is on the mend (Picture: WireImage)

On Monday morning, Clue told his Instagram followers that he would not be ‘giving my energy to this situation’ after coming clean.

Responding to previous accusations that he leaked the clip for ‘clout’, Clue hit back: ‘What are you going to gain off your bredrin, your brother? You want to see your people do good.’

Krept, 29, broke his silence after the attack to assure fans of his health and wellbeing.

‘My people thanks for the messages Im good, ill be back in no time. God was with me trust me. Cant keep a good man down [sic],’ he tweeted on Sunday.

In the audio clip, he is heard explaining that around 30 thugs approached him backstage and grabbed the chain dedicated to his late cousin Cadet, who died in February. The large group of attackers then stabbed him multiple times in several places on his body.

West Midlands Police have appealed to the public to contact them with any information they may have about the incident.

BBC 1Xtra Live was expected to see Wizkid headline and featured the likes of AJ Tracey, French Montana, Aitch and Ms Banks on the line-up.
